unnormalised: **Environmental News: India's Renewable Energy Push Gathers Momentum**
normalised: **Environmental News: India's Renewable Energy Push Gathers Momentum**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India – Driven by a commitment to reduce carbon emissions and enhance energy security, India is significantly expanding its renewable energy capacity. Experts at the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Madras are developing innovative solar panel technologies optimized for the Indian climate, potentially boosting efficiency by up to 15%.
normalised: New Delhi, India – Driven by a commitment to reduce carbon emissions and enhance energy security, India is significantly expanding its renewable energy capacity. Experts at the Indian Institute of Technology (I I T) Madras are developing innovative solar panel technologies optimized for the Indian climate, potentially boosting efficiency by up to fifteen percent.

unnormalised: The government's "National Green Hydrogen Mission" aims to make India a global hub for green hydrogen production, targeting 5 million tonnes annually by 2030. Rajasthan is leading the way with large-scale solar parks, covering hundreds of square kilometers. These parks are projected to generate enough clean electricity to power millions of homes.
normalised: The government's "National Green Hydrogen Mission" aims to make India a global hub for green hydrogen production, targeting five million tonnes annually by two thousand and thirty. Rajasthan is leading the way with large-scale solar parks, covering hundreds of square kilometers. These parks are projected to generate enough clean electricity to power millions of homes.

unnormalised: This year, during the Onam festival in Kerala, many homes relied almost entirely on solar power, showcasing the growing adoption of renewable energy at the household level. Experts estimate investments in the renewable sector could reach Rs. 20 lakh crore by 2030, creating lakhs of jobs and helping India achieve its net-zero targets.
normalised: This year, during the Onam festival in Kerala, many homes relied almost entirely on solar power, showcasing the growing adoption of renewable energy at the household level. Experts estimate investments in the renewable sector could reach rupee twenty lakh crore by two thousand and thirty, creating lakhs of jobs and helping India achieve its net-zero targets.
